div.l: Sek lay þᵉ maıı̄uncypele on a malady
Men wendyn wisely þᵗat he schulde dey
For which this mellere stal bothe mele ⁊and corn
An hundere tyme more þān be forn
For þ̉ere be forn he stal but curteysly
But now he was a thef outragyously
For whych þe wardeyn schod ⁊and made fare
But therof sette this mellere not a tare
He crakyth bost ⁊and swor it was not so
Þānne were there pore clerkys too
That dwelledyn in þis halle of whiche I seyde
Testyf þey were ⁊and lusty for to pleye
And only for here myrthe ⁊and reuerye
Vp on þᵉ wardeyn besily þey crye
To ȝeue hem leue but a lite stoıı̄unde
To gon to melle to sen here corn I groıı̄unde
And hardelyhadelyhardely þey durste leyn here nekke
The mellere schulde not stele hēm half a pekke
Of corn be sleyghte ne be forse hēm reue
And at þᵉ laste þᵉ wardeyn ȝaf hēm leue
Ion highte þᵗat on ⁊and aleyn hyghte þᵗat oþ̉er
Of on toun were þey born þᵗat hyghte strother
Fer in the north I can not tellyn where
This aleyn makyth redy al hese gere
And on an hors he caste þᵉ sak a non
Forth goth aleyn þᵉ clerk ⁊and also Ion
Wᵗith good swerd ⁊and bokeler bi here syde
Ion knew þᵉ weye hēm nedyth no gyde
And at þᵉ melle þᵉ sak a doıı̄un he leyth
Aleyn spak fyrst alheyl symound in feyth
How farys þyn fayre douȝtyr ⁊and thyn wif
Aleyn wolcome ꝙquod symkyn be myn lyf
And Iohn also how now what do ȝe here
Symond ꝙquod Iohn bi god nede has no pere
He muste serue hȳm self þᵗat has no sweyn
Or ellis he is a fol as clerkis seyn
